abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton will give commanders in field greater authority to decide how to punish officers for low-level infractions, shift from department's centralized enforcement of rules; says effort is designed to improve officers' attitudes about their jobs, which could in turn affect way they police people in neighborhoods they serve; strategy has risks, as many corruption scandals have stemmed from lax culture surrounding errors made by officers.
lead_paragraph: Police Commissioner William J. Bratton, hoping to improve officers’ morale, is giving commanders in the field more authority in disciplining those who commit minor infractions.

headline.main: Bratton Tries a Community Policing Approach, on the New York Police
headline.print_headline: New York Police Shift Approach on Discipline
